cscd210Methods.gameMethods

Class GuessTheWordGameMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd210Methods.gameMethods.GuessTheWordGameMethods

  • public class GuessTheWordGameMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    The game methods for the guess the word game.

    NOTE: There is a class level constant declared right after the curly bracket "{" of the class that declaration is public static final int TOTAL = 7;

    NOTE: This class resides in the subpackage gameMethods under the package cscd210Methods

    package cscd210Methods.gameMethods;
    Remember all parameters will be final

    • Method Detail

      • readGuess

        public static char readGuess(java.util.Scanner kb,
                             java.lang.String player)
        The readGuess method prompts the player by name to enter a character. The method then reads a character from the keyboard, ensures it is in the range of lowercase 'a' to lowercase 'z' and returns the charater.
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner to the keyboard
        player - Representing the String of the player name
        Returns:
        char Representing a character between lowercase a and lowercase z
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the String is null or empty
        Post_Condition:
        The input buffer will be empty

      • checkGuess

        public static int checkGuess(char guess,
                             char[] wordToGuess,
                             int incorrectGuesses)
        The checkGuess method checks to see if the guess is in the wordToGuess array. If the guess is there then the old incorrect guesses count is returned. If the guess is not there then the incorrect guess count is incremented by 1 and then returned.
        Parameters:
        guess - Representing the letter that was guessed
        wordToGuess - Representing the array of characters that contains the word to be guessed
        incorrectGuesses - Representing the number of incorrect guesses by the user
        Returns:
        int Representing the number of incorrect guesses by the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the guess is < a or > z
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the wordToGuess is null or length is < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the incorrect guesses is < 0 or > 7

      • display

        public static boolean display(char guess,
                              char[] wordToGuess,
                              char[] guessedLetters,
                              char[] displayGuessedLettersWordToGuess,
                              int incorrectGuesses)
        The display method does the following:
        The wordToGuess so far: either the letter guessed is displayed or a - is displayed
        The letters that have been guessed so far either as a letter or a -
        The number of guesses left out of the TOTAL
        Parameters:
        guess - Representing the letter that was guessed
        wordToGuess - Representing the array of characters that contains the word to be guessed
        guessedLetters - Representing the 26 character in the alphabet if the letter has been guessed it will be displayed otherwise a - will be displayed
        displayGuessedLettersWordToGuess - Representing the character in the wordToGuess if the letter guessed is in the wordToGuess it will be displayed otherwise a - will be displayed
        incorrectGuesses - Representing the number of incorrect guesses by the user
        Returns:
        boolean Representing if the entire wordToGuess has been guessed correctly
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the guess is < a or > z
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the wordToGuess is null or length is < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the guessedLetters is null or length is < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the displayGuessedLettersWordToGuess is null or length is < 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the incorrect guesses is < 0 or > 7

      • initializeDisplay

        public static char[] initializeDisplay(char[] wordToGuess)
        the initalizeDisplay creates an array of the same length of wordToGuess and initializes the elements in the array with '-' in each element.
        Parameters:
        wordToGuess - Representing the wordToGuess and its length
        Returns:
        char [] Representing an array filled with '-' in each element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the wordToGuess is null or length is < 1

      • initializeDisplay

        public static char[] initializeDisplay(int total)
        the initalizeDisplay creates an array of the size passed in and then initializes the elements in the array with '-' in each element.
        Parameters:
        total - Representing the number of elements to create in the array
        Returns:
        char [] Representing an array filled with '-' in each element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the total is < 1
